You do *not* want to "apt-get install grub", that would install grub legacy.
Can you try booting the server (without the liveCD) and holding shift during boot to get to the grub menu, then at the grub menu select an older kernel?
It says that grub is not broken (though there is a chance that it's misconfigured, that'f fairly low).
I doubt that your grub directory is gone.
Ubuntu doesn't use initrd or vmlinuz symlinks.
